title: Bug 49299 - Servlet 3.0 ch.7.1.1 incorrect statement about custom cookie name and URL rewriting
description: Bug 49299 in Servlet 3.0 Chapter 7.1.1 states that a custom cookie name affects URL rewriting.
OB: In the provided attachment 25442 [details]cookiename.war, chapter 7.1.1 of the servlet30finalspec.pdf states that if a web application configures a custom name for its session tracking cookies, the same custom name should also be used as the name of the URI parameter if the session ID is encoded in the URL (assuming URL rewriting is enabled). However, the observed behavior does not align with this statement. Instead of using the custom cookie name, the Reload link on the page uses 'jsessionid' as the name of the parameter in the URL.
EB: The expected behavior is that if a web application configures a custom name for its session tracking cookies, the custom name should also be used as the name of the URI parameter if the session ID is encoded in the URL (assuming URL rewriting is enabled). Thus, the expected result should be that the Reload link on the page uses the custom cookie name as the name of the parameter in the URL.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Open the provided attachment 25442 [details]cookiename.war.
2. Navigate to the page where the Reload link is displayed.
3. Click on the Reload link.
4. Observe that the name of the parameter in the URL is 'jsessionid' instead of the custom cookie name.
